sections.content: Welcome to an exciting exploration of world religions! üåè In this lesson, we will delve into the beliefs, practices, and cultural influences of Christianity, Islam, Judaism, Hinduism, and Buddhism. These religions have shaped human societies and continue to impact the world in profound ways.
sections.title: Introduction to World Religions

sections.content: Christianity is the largest religion, with over 2.3 billion followers. It originated in the 1st century CE in the Middle East. The Bible, containing the Old and New Testaments, serves as its sacred text. Christians believe in one God and that Jesus Christ is the Son of God, whose sacrifice offers salvation through faith and grace. Key practices include worship, prayer, and sacraments like baptism and communion. Christianity has deeply influenced art, literature, and ethics globally.
sections.title: Christianity

sections.content: Islam, with over 1.9 billion followers, began in the 7th century CE in the Arabian Peninsula. The Quran is its holy book, believed to be revealed to Prophet Muhammad. Its core beliefs include monotheism (Allah) and the Five Pillars: faith declaration, prayer, fasting, charity, and pilgrimage to Mecca. Rituals include daily prayers and fasting during Ramadan. Islam has contributed significantly to fields like science, mathematics, and architecture.
sections.title: Islam

sections.content: Judaism, one of the oldest monotheistic religions, has around 15 million followers. It originated over 3,000 years ago in the Middle East. The Torah, part of the Hebrew Bible, is its sacred text. Central beliefs include a covenant with God and ethical teachings like the Ten Commandments. Rituals include observing the Sabbath and festivals such as Passover and Hanukkah. Jewish traditions have influenced Western ethics, philosophy, and arts.
sections.title: Judaism

sections.content: Hinduism, with a history spanning over 4,000 years, is practiced by approximately 1.2 billion people. It recognizes a divine force, Brahman, expressed through various deities. Fundamental concepts include karma, reincarnation, and dharma (moral duty). Rituals involve temple worship, meditation, and festivals like Diwali and Holi. Hindu philosophy and practices like yoga have influenced global spirituality and culture.
sections.title: Hinduism
themes: Hindu concepts of karma and dharma

sections.content: Buddhism, founded in the 6th century BCE by Siddhartha Gautama, has around 500 million followers. The Four Noble Truths and the Eightfold Path form its core teachings, emphasizing mindfulness and enlightenment. Rituals include meditation and festivals like Vesak. Buddhism has enriched art, literature, and philosophy, and its practices, such as meditation, have gained global popularity.
sections.title: Buddhism

sections.content: The major world religions‚ÄîChristianity, Islam, Judaism, Hinduism, and Buddhism‚Äîoffer unique perspectives on life, spirituality, and morality. Common themes include moral guidance, rituals, and community. Their historical significance and cultural impact have shaped societies, arts, and philosophies worldwide. Understanding these religions fosters appreciation for human diversity and shared values.
